metadata.ttm:title: Importing a Digital Certificate (Internet Explorer)
metadata.ttm:desc: Once you have acquired your Digital Certificate, you will need to upload it to the internet browser you use to access the eOffer/eMod system. This video walks you through the Certificate import steps for the Microsoft Internet Explorer web browser.

div.p: Once you have received your Digital Certificate,
you will need to install it on your web browser.
This video covers installation instructions
for Internet Explorer.
In your browser's "Menu bar" click "Tools" and
then "Internet Options."
Open the "Content" tab.
Then click "Certificates."
Make sure the "Personal" tab is selected Click the
"Import" button.
This will launch the Import Wizard, click next.
Click browse and make sure the "File Type" is set to
Personal Information Exchange" (PIF).
Now select your digital certificate.
Enter your private key's password.
It is important to note at this time that neither the
cert provider nor GSA can recover your password.
Thus if you forget or lose it, you'll have to buy a
new certificate altogether.
You have the following options: First, enabling
strong private key protection requires you to
enter your chosen password when you use your cert,
for example, every time you log in to eOffer/eMod.
This option is certainly preferable when you are
using a shared computer as it reduces the possibility
that someone else could use your certificate.
Secondly, you may allow this key to be exported
later into a
.pfx file.
This is useful if you need to copy your certificate
onto another computer.
Finally, "Include all extended properties" is
checked by default.
You should leave this checked.
Now click "Next."
The next screen asks where you would like to store
your cert, choose Personal, and click next.
You will see one final summary screen, click
"Finish", and you should get a success message.
Click "OK" and you will see your digital cert show
up under the "Personal" tab.
